uiBuilder.label: K23 Photobooth Camera
uiBuilder.description: The photobooth lab's camera from CreatorCon 23!

properties.name: enabled
properties.label: Enabled
properties.description: Whether or not the camera stream is enabled.

properties.name: snapRequested
properties.label: Snap Requested
properties.description: A string containing timestamp that can be passed down to trigger a snap. Use script to set this value such as Date.now()

properties.name: countdownDurationSeconds
properties.label: Countdown Duration Seconds
properties.description: Number of seconds to wait after Snap Requested to take the shot

actions.label: Photo Booth Camera Snapped
actions.description: Dispatched when a photo is snapped.  Includes the imageData in the payload.

payload.name: imageData
payload.label: Image Data
payload.description: The image data from the camera after the snap is completed

actions.label: Photo booth Available Cameras Updated
actions.description: Dispatched when the available cameras are updated.

payload.name: cameras
payload.label: Cameras
payload.description: List of camera objects with the label, deviceId, id (same as deviceId), groupId and kind fields. [{deviceId, id, kind, groupId, kind}]. See https://webrtc.org/

payload.name: selectedDeviceIdFound
payload.label: Selected Device ID was Found
payload.description: Whether or not the Selected Camera Device ID was found and is in use. If 'false' check Actual Camera Device ID (boundCameraDeviceId) to see if another camera was selected instead.

payload.name: boundCameraDeviceId
payload.label: Actual Camera Device ID
payload.description: The Device ID of the camera that is actually being used. (May be different from the Selected Camera Device ID if that device could not be found but another camera was available.)
